intro: Chaetogastra echinata, commonly known as the spiny chaetogastra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and hairy, lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals, and it produces capsules as its fruit. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
